Comment: ## Summary:    Mattel said it’s considering raising prices on U.S. toy shoppers, a warning that comes one day after **President Donald Trump doubled down on comments that American children don’t need more than a handful of dolls**.  **Trump’s tariffs have put price hikes** on the table: “Where necessary, we will be taking pricing action in the U.S.”  Mattel said Monday that it still expects 40% to 50% of its products to cost $20 or less  **Mattel’s stock has fallen more than 18% since April 2**, the day Trump unveiled a sweeping set of global tariffs that he partially walked back days later.   The company held off providing a financial outlook for the year, a step Ford also took Monday.
Author: Aakash7aak

Comment: "Asked on CNBC on Tuesday whether Mattel could realistically bring more manufacturing back into the U.S. — one of the Trump administration’s top goals with tariffs — Kreiz said, “We don’t see that happening.”"
Author: koi-lotus-water-pond

Comment: As a “high end” action figure collector, I can safely say these things are already overpriced. The factories making the legit stuff were also churning out bootlegs minus the corporate trademarks branded on the figures. A $25 figure here was $5-6 shipped from China. Virtually indistinguishable. Same with Lego. Knockoffs just remove the Lego from the pegs and I’ve seen finished pieces that cost $150 as a bootleg that are being sold for $700-800 by Lego. And I’ve also seen the bootlegs packaged better  in terms of bagging bricks.
Author: M-O-D-O-K
